message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public static void main(String[] args) {
    String split_vls = "11. Welcome to java programming |1. Oops concepts |12. Encapsulation |3.Abstraction  |14.Inheritance  |5.Polymorphism";
    String[] Numeric_split = split_vls.split("\\|");
    for (String pipes_Split : Numeric_split) {
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(pipes_Split, ".");
        if (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
            st.nextToken();
            if (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
                System.out.println(st.nextToken().trim());
            }
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The code first splits the string by the pipe symbol '|'. Then for each split string, it creates a StringTokenizer with '.' as the delimiter. It then calls nextToken() twice. The first call to nextToken() discards the numeric part and the second call to nextToken() retrieves the text part. The trim() method is used to remove leading and trailing spaces.
